citation.article-title: Devosia albogilva sp. nov. and Devosia crocina sp. nov., isolated from a hexachlorocyclohexane dump site.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Devosia crocina sp. nov.
Devosia crocina (cro.ci′na. L. fem. adj. crocina saffron-coloured).
Gram-negative, aerobic, oval, non-spore-forming and motile with a single polar flagellum.
Colonies are bright orange in colour, circular with entire margins and 0.5–2.0 mm in size when grown on LB agar plates for 3 days.
Grows well on LB agar and TSA.
Temperature, pH and NaCl concentration ranges for growth are 5–32 °C, 5–9 and 0–3 %, respectively.
Assimilates l-arabinose, galactose, fructose, d-mannitol, mannose, xylose, maltose and lactose, but not sucrose, myo-inositol or glucose.
Positive for oxidase, urease and β-galactosidase activities and aesculin hydrolysis, but negative for catalase, DNase, lipase and nitrate reductase activities.
Does not hydrolyse casein, gelatin or starch.
Does not utilize citrate or produce indole.
Sensitive to ciprofloxacin, gentamicin, chloramphenicol, rifampicin, amikacin, ampicillin, vancomycin and tetracycline; resistant to polymyxin B and kanamycin.
Major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c/C18 : 1ω6c and C16 : 0.
The type strain is IPL20T (=CCM 7425T=MTCC 8590T), isolated from an HCH dump site in India.
